title: 2026 Super Bowl: Tom Brady is gone, but the New England Patriots are back
subhed: Led by young quarterback Drake Maye, who hopes to follow in the footsteps of the former NFL star, the New England franchise returns to the American football championship game on Sunday to face the Seattle Seahawks.

title: UN prepares convention on crimes against humanity
Epstein affair: Keir Starmer's chief of staff resigns over Mandelson appointment
AI's impact on entire sectors of the economy shakes Wall Street
subhed: Investors have abandoned sectors like software in favor of the traditional Dow Jones, which has broken through the 50,000-point mark.
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: PSG pound Marseille and move back to top of Ligue 1
subhed: Luis Enrique's Paris Saint-Germain, who beat Marseille 5-0 on Sunday, have now won seven straight league matches, though they remain under pressure from surprise challengers Lens, who briefly moved to the top slot on Saturday and sit just two points behind.

title: French cosmetics sales drop in the US after being struck by tariffs
subhed: French production has struggled in the United States, its leading export market, amid competition from Korean brands.

title: At Centre Pompidou-Metz, the late resurrection of sculptor Louise Nevelson
subhed: The American artist, known in the 1960s for her monumental and forbidding installations, is on display at the Moselle museum.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: 'Quad God' Malinin seals figure skating team gold for US
Israel announces measures to deepen control over West Bank
Japan's ruling party on track for an overwhelming majority in snap legislative elections
Thailand's conservative prime minister defies expectations to win general election
Iran nuclear talks: Fragile resumption of discussions between Washington and Tehran
byline: By Ghazal Golshiri and Philippe Ricard

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Lindsey Vonn's comeback ends in a violent crash
Trump shares racist video depicting the Obamas as monkeys, leaving White House scrambling
Robert Crumb, comic book author: 'I am a paranoid person and I make fun of that'
The bride wore Birkenstocks
The Netherlands learns a lesson on right and far-right alliances
After the Epstein revelations, Jack Lang leaves a mixed record at the Arab World Institute
French companies cut down on drinking at work
byline: By Frédéric Brillet and Anne Rodier

title: 'Dependence on the US is deeply rooted in the European mindset'
subhed: Europe continues to struggle to find its own voice on the international stage because it remains trapped in a cognitive dependence on Washington, writes Rosa Balfour, director of the Carnegie Europe think tank.

title: Bruno Retailleau, a hardline conservative ready to run for French president
subhed: While he has claimed not to have the presidential election 'virus,' the leader of Les Républicains has been working on a candidacy for the 2027 election. The only questions left are how and when to announce his bid.

title: Jacob Helberg, Trump's direct link to France's far right
subhed: Everyone in the French far right who wants to get close to Donald Trump knows that Jacob Helberg is the man to speak to. The French-American, a young under secretary of state for economic affairs, serves as a conduit for the reactionary, nationalist and anti-immigration vision that the president wants to impose on Europe.

title: Epstein scandal tarnishes former minister Jack Lang and France's image
'In the US, Christian nationalism contributes to the dismantling of democracy'
'Trump put liberal democracy in the crosshairs in 2025, he might pull the trigger in 2026'
